text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but simply moving on with dignity despite that fear.
author: Pat Riley

text: Pitching is the art of instilling fear.
author: Sandy Koufax

text: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
author: Sammy Davis Jr.

text: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
author: Richard Bach

text: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
author: The Buddha

text: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
author: Richard Bach

text: Fear grows in darkness; if you think there's a bogeyman around, turn on the light.
author: Dorothy Thompson

text: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
author: Léon Blum

text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
author: The Buddha

text: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
author: The Buddha

text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
author: Confucius

text: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
author: Jane Addams

text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
author: Marie Curie

text: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

text: In romance, we feel the need to zoom in and expound on our partner's foibles in intimate detail; in friendship, we tend to do the opposite, avoiding confrontation through fear, lethargy or both.
author: Mariella Frostrup

text: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
author: Walter Inglis Anderson

text: Fear is your worst enemy. Risk is your best friend.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt
